text: Heard renovation drills at dawn once; thought it was Armageddon!
Zone out forecasting city growth at cafes sometimes!
In urban development circles, seeing more diversity lately – leadership roles too!
Plans without flexibility are just incomplete blueprints; same goes for relationships. We need room for change—think dynamic city plans over static ones—they adapt like we should too.
Solid foundations aren't just metaphorical either!
Foundations matter because they set parameters for growth—not just start points. Cities evolve around core plans; like those areas thrive best with foresight combined with flexibility!
Back home beaches are planned out for use + least environmental damage. Seeing some overseas spots felt unplanned was honestly baffling—even more than different trees or architecture!
Cycling paths? More like obstacle courses!
Totally! Breezy Perth shaped me too - laid-back yet ready for anything.
Navigating those twisty paths definitely instils some out-of-the-box thinking! Urban planning kinda demands it; gotta find clever solutions for city spaces all the time!
West coast upbringing instilled laid-back resilience—still guides me.
